messages.title: Change that works for you
messages.content: Sal Brinton talks about local people's feelings of frustration, ignorance, and anger at how the country is run. The message emphasizes the opportunity for real change with a Liberal Democrat MP.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Plans to invest in a new hospital and to get more resources for hardworking medical staff. Aims to work to get more school places and smaller class sizes in local schools.
Calls for a focus on creating jobs for people in their local town, not just in the city.
Wants to increase the number of school places and reduce class sizes.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The leaflet portrays a tactical situation suggesting that only the Lib Dems or Labour can win in Watford and that voting Conservative would only help re-elect a Labour MP.

issues.economy: Mentions the desire for economic policies that benefit locals, rather than focusing only on the city.
issues.education: Advocates for more school places and smaller class sizes.
issues.health: Emphasizes the need for a new hospital and better resources for medical staff.

housing.content: No specific policies on housing mentioned in the leaflet.

leaflet.personalStatement: Sal Brinton promises to be a different kind of MP, one who listens and speaks up on behalf of constituents.

contactInformation.address: Sal Brinton's HQ, Unit 27 Empire Centre, Imperial Way, Watford, WD24 4YH

images.caption: Image of Sal Brinton with the text 'Change that works for you' and various campaign slogans and contact information.
